website_summaries.verdict: This walks a thin line between "portable" and "luggable," but is the cooler in the Tundra series which represents the best of both worlds in terms of size and portability.
pros: 65-ounce capacity makes this YETI cooler about as large as you'll be able to get and still have a cooler that you can legitimately call "portable
cons: It's 29 pounds when empty, so imagine the weight of it when ice and food are added

website_summaries.verdict: This top cooler is tough and rugged. It's perfect for camping, tailgating, and picnicking.
cons: The price is high, but you're paying for the best on the market

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done! I own three Yeti coolers. Tho not cheap, they keep ice longer than any cooler I've ever owned. The 65 is my work horse. From camping to Hotel stays to concerts at the park, this thing keeps the drinks and snacks cold. Lots of compliments when out and about. Easy to clean too. I'm a believer.
customer_reviews.author: The Niner

customer_reviews.title: Ice for days I think NOT save your money folks!
customer_reviews.text: Way overpriced and does not hold ice any longer than a regular igloo cooler. Very disappointed I bought two Yeti’s coolers and they don’t hold ice for days like everyone says they do. I tested mine many times very disappointed. Built well and very heavy Yes, other that save your money folks. 24 lbs of ice melted in less than 28 hrs in a controlled climate garage see pic attached. Opened the cooler a total,of 3 times water is cool but ice is GONE! Going to see if I can send them back!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: It is very heavy when full
customer_reviews.text: Nice cooler. I work in plastics so when I got it I noticed there was a lot of flash on the parting line and lifter areas of the mold. For as much money as these things are i would expect a product that is free of molding defects. Also thought it would hold ice longer than it has so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jim O.

customer_reviews.title: but super efficient. Keeps ice 3x longer than every other ...
customer_reviews.text: Heavy as hell, but super efficient. Keeps ice 3x longer than every other "normal" cooler. It makes for a great bench to sit on, or it can double as a step up into a higher vehicle. This better be the last cooler I ever buy, because I can't afford another one. Haha
customer_reviews.author: Creeks Pub

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: TOO heavy to lift, especially after you get your drinks stuffed in there. Didn't keep ice any better than the big cheap Coleman I have. Wish I would've kept the box so I could send it back. I cannot afford to just throw away $350.00! So po'ed!
customer_reviews.author: Anita C. Dudding

customer_reviews.title: This is so expensive for a ice chest, however ...
customer_reviews.text: This is so expensive for a ice chest, however last Aug we put dry ice on the bottom and filled with bags of ice, our ice lasted 7 days in Lake Powell in mid Aug. Drinks, milk, cheese, yogurt, etc. were all kept fresh and Ice cold... It really is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: KELLY M.

customer_reviews.title: Barely any melted ice after 3. 5days - used ...
customer_reviews.text: Barely any melted ice after 3.5days - used 9lb of dry ice and ~3lb of regular ice. After 2 days some of the drinks were frozen solid when they were only refrigerator-cold going in. Would have stayed cold even longer but that was the end of our trip! Wish it had wheels because its very heavy but functionality outweighs it.
customer_reviews.author: Fun in the sun

customer_reviews.title: It’s the real deal
customer_reviews.text: Took this on it’s first trip during the Indy 500 along with an igloo cooler. Igloo lost its ice within 3 hours, this beast was still cold and had ice after three days in the blistering heat. The white is easy to clean contrary to what some are saying.
customer_reviews.author: TMG

customer_reviews.title: Not the long term quality expected!
customer_reviews.text: I expected it to last longer considering the purported quality and price. I bought the Yeti Tundra 65 in early 2014. We use it exclusively "inside." It's our car cooler for road trips. So, it's in the basement when not in use and in the car when we're on road trips. It's already exhibiting cracking of the plastic and the rubber closures are rotten. Don't expect your money to go far.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A Lentz

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - Individual Issues
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cooler; however, the item has clearly been used by someone. There are cosmetic scratches on the surface, and there was a stain on the inside of it (granted, it was easy to clean). The seller should be inspecting these products before shipping to end customers given the price. My one star is not for the product, itself, but for the distribution and quality assurance. As I write this, the Coronavirus is shutting down supply chains and reducing access to certain products. In any other circumstance I would return this, but I don't have that luxury at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Forrest Benton

customer_reviews.title: Incredible quality
customer_reviews.text: Incredible quality as expected for the price. Long term investment to be sure but seeing this with my own eyes I know I'll be using this for the rest of my lifetime
customer_reviews.author: N G

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Way more hyped up then it is. Its not Worth the money. my older "regular" ice chest work almost as well and they are afraction of the cost. The durability is excellent and it is made very very well, but is not much better at keeping things cooler than your 29.95 icechest from a generic brand. Advice...its better to buy 5 regular ice chest over tour lifetime than to waste your money on one of these....you would still have a ton of money left over for other things.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Vargas

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: I heard all the hype and found one on sale. Thought long and hard whether I wanted to purchase this since I purchased one of the “off brands” at Walmart for a fourth of the cost. Even with this being the sale cost!!! Dang!!! I was extremely disappointed! It doesn’t keep the ice cold hardly a day much less as it advertises! U have to dump it over to empty it there is no valve. So if u have a bad back, you definitely do not want to get this! I wouldn’t suggest anyone buy it anyway!! If someone were to give me one now I wouldn’t even regift it to someone I really didn’t like!!! Hated it that much!!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Casselman

customer_reviews.title: Scratched and dented cooler, questionable buy
customer_reviews.text: Just got the cooler out of the box and am pretty disappointed that this cooler has scratches and dings all over the outside. The actual shipping box wasn’t damaged so I can only assume that someone else returned this one after using and abusing it and they shipped it out the me. Other than that seems like a nice cooler, but for $350 you would think you would deserve an undamaged product.. pretty disappointed. Recommend buying one in person at a store and skip going through Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: Too much money
customer_reviews.text: I think it’s a lot of money when my igloo cooler does the same thing for a fraction of the money.
customer_reviews.author: yjornik

customer_reviews.title: This cooler froze my food!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We went on a 4 day 3 night boat camping trip in the Florida Keys just a few days ago. Outside it was in the 90s and humid!!! I put our hamburger meat in the cooler and since it was thawed, it was to be our first meal. We left at 9AM and at 7PM when I went to get the hamburger out to make dinner, the hamburger was frozen! We came home after 4 days in the hot sun with ice still in the cooler - just one 10 pound bag and 3 yeti freezer packs and 2 cool packs on the top. AMAZING!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: After researching for weeks comparable sized coolers, this is what I got. Ice retention for a weekend camping trip and general beverage cooler for parties are its main duties. A bit overkill, but I never once added ice while camping (unlike the others) and there was still water ice when we came home. The rubber feet make it hard to move when loading into or out of a trunk, but that is my only complaint. This looks like it will last my lifetime. Well worth it if you need to keep things cold for long periods.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Whitehead

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service goes a long way
customer_reviews.text: Cooler arrived , used it once and the drain plug leaked all over the back of my Jeep. I called yeti and they immediatly sent me 2 new plugs. That did not solve the problem so I call them again and filled out the warranty on a Friday at 4:30. Monday afternoon they called me and told me they were sending me a new cooler. It arrived in 2 days and is working fine. I could have been pissed about paying $360 for a bad cooler but their customer service was top notch. No recordings, no-one trying to sell me ink. Kind of made up for the issue with the cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Tch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent icechest
customer_reviews.text: We gave this Yeti the ultimate test: Loaded it down with meat, milk, juice, beer and eggs then placed it in the back of our pickup truck with a campershell while we road tripped through: Death Valley, Las Vegas and northern Nevada for three days. We used two Yeti blue ice blocks and a bag of regular ice. Still had ice at the end of day three. I really wish I had waited a few weeks to buy the Yeti with the wheels. This one is unwieldy for one, especially when weighed down. I've been looking for a wheel set, no luck yet.
customer_reviews.author: Michel

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This cooler leaks. Brand new and the first time I used it it leaked. I had the plug screwed in tight and it has a rubber washer, but it still steadily dripped water. I expected more from a $349. cooler. My two steel 54 quart Colemans kept ice almost as well and did not drip one drop and they are both old.
customer_reviews.author: CasaDeChihuahua

customer_reviews.title: Love it! I have used it every weekend after ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I have used it every weekend after receiving it. Definitely happy I decided to pull the trigger on a YETI. Also as a side note I was concerned that "YETI Authorized" was an actual approved dealer. I was able to reach out to YETI where they confirmed that they are in fact approved, which is comforting when spending this kind of money!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Daley

customer_reviews.title: Why is it called a YETI Tundra 65? Not because of the capacity. Should be Tundra 52.
customer_reviews.text: Our YETI cooler just arrived this afternoon, but I wanted to share first impressions. It appears durable and I expect it will live up to the YETI reputation for keeping food cold. However, I'm puzzled as to why it's called a Tundra 65. I mistakenly assumed the 65 in the model name referred to its capacity. That's fairly standard for coolers and there is nothing in the description to indicate otherwise. However, its capacity is actually only 52 quarts. Also, I'm surprised the lid will not remain open unless held in the open position which will make it difficult to remove items.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie Orr

customer_reviews.title: Yaaaasss
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars, hands down, keeps ice icy, keeps drinks cold. Not too heavy when full, perfect for camping, chillin, it’s honestly game for whatever. Definitely would recommend. The price is a little steep, but for the quality, the brand, the icy ice, you can’t do much better!
customer_reviews.author: Zita Cadottersbach

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Nice to find a product so well made as this. I bought it essentially for catering big parties and needed added refrigeration space, this held ice almost a week before the ice started to melt! I also bought the Yeti 125, what I love about this is it is so well designed, it is a system that includes the use of their ice blocks that fit inside the cooler perfectly. No criticisms at all, they are not kidding when they say it is grizzly proof. Great warranty, excellent company, I feel very good about this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ACRA

customer_reviews.title: Great buy especially if you work outside
customer_reviews.text: Alittle pricey but my husband loves it this is the second yeti cooler we've bought he works outside so he always went through ice quick this he fills up once and it lasts all day sometimes works alittle too good freezes his waters
customer_reviews.author: kay

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this cooler! Yes worth it. Pre-chill with dry ice and the put regular ice in. Keeps regular ice frozen for a day+. The divider and basket really helped to keep things organized.
customer_reviews.author: Kebe

customer_reviews.title: Beastmode!
customer_reviews.text: Beastmode! Why did I wait so long to get this baby??? If you use a cooler regularly then just bite the bullet and get a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Lincoln

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cooler. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Although pricey, this cooler saved the day when my refrigerator compressor went our recently and the manufacturer couldn't get a new one installed for nearly one week. Very impressed with Yeti. Worth the investment. For 5 days, this cooler kept ice packs solidly frozen which saved the day (and the food I put in it). I've never had a cooler as good as this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: So happy with the 65
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research to determine the right Yeti for me. The 65 won and I could not be happier. Delivery was smooth. Box had no damage and the cooler was pristine. Will buy again as soon as the Haul is released
customer_reviews.author: Erik Jansen

customer_reviews.title: awesome  cooler
customer_reviews.text: I love this cooler well worth the money only down side she's heavy when loaded up but I cant complain cause its truly a awesome cooler I'll never own any thing other then the yetti
customer_reviews.author: robbie nelson

customer_reviews.title: Quality & Insulation
customer_reviews.text: Love my yeti. I picked up the 65 quart tundra in the river green color. Loaded it up with beverages & food and the ice did last over 4 days. Appreciate the ability to lock both ends with the bear proof locks, also the bottle opener/ cable lock is another plus.
customer_reviews.author: FUKU

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I bought an open box one from Amazon. Just had a little dirt on it and the original Yeti packaging was beat up. But it said me a bunch of money! I have been waiting to buy one of these coolers for a while and I cant wait to start using it! The River color looks awesome in person!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Allison

customer_reviews.title: Love YETI
customer_reviews.text: We love the brand and quality this product lives up too. Yup a bit pricey but I guess you get what you pay for? Well it’s situational I would say. And most of it is all opinion. We like it and got this small cooler for travel when we take frozen milk for our baby.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: If you follow what Yeti has on their page for “keeping ice”, you’ll get the most out of this cooler. It will even keep the water cold when the ice does melt. With that being said, we had to replace the ice 1.5 times during our 9-day trip.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Lawrence Chamberlain

customer_reviews.title: This thing is huge...
customer_reviews.text: Good cooler. Kept things cold for several days. Needed a cooler for the jeep to water and beer cold while when we offroad. Based on dimensions, this thing appeared to be a little bit bigger than my 15 year old Coleman cooler. Not so! The Tundra 65 is huge, It has capacity and then some. Fully loaded it weighs more than 50 lbs. The appearance / quality of the cooler is first rate. This thing will last a lifetime. I expect it to be the last cooler I ever buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best cooler I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Used 5- 6x9x1 ice packs across the bottom and packed the cooler with drinks and snacks. It sat I n the sun, getting opened and closed for 6-8 hrs. Anytime I grabbed a drink during that time, it was perfectly cold! This is easily the best cooler I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cool
customer_reviews.text: Built to last and to take a beating. Does what it’s supposed to do but for a premium price. The drainage plug is not on the same par as the rest of the cooler, but an easy DIY fix with a little plumber’s tape around the plug.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: High quality cooler
customer_reviews.text: I'm not in love with Yeti's politics, but their coolers are excellent quality and this size fits my needs perfectly. This is the second one I have purchased; my first was a 105. They really do keep your food cold for a long time if you pack them properly. Rugged and very dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Steven B

customer_reviews.title: Does keep ice longer
customer_reviews.text: Cooler is very sturdy and well insulated. Keeps ice longer than anything I've ever used before. The only drawback is the cost. The company that makes them is VERY PROUD of their product. Five stars for everything except the price.
customer_reviews.author: JV.

customer_reviews.title: No regrets
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping and package came undamaged. I love it! I’ve been going to the beach a lot this summer so I’ve been needing a cooler but I’ve only been wanting a pink one. Well $400 later, I got it. No regrets
customer_reviews.author: Lexy Zorotrian

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away!!
customer_reviews.text: 1st one arrived great with no problems, despite the condition of the box. 2nd one arrived today via Fedex, with a stove in corner. Stay away from this vendor. A word to the wise.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel P. Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but still a great product
customer_reviews.text: It’s a yeti.... expensive !!! Thank goodness I got it during prime days !!! Otherwise, I am not sure I would have bought on one. Still a great product though!!
customer_reviews.author: ST0NEWHITE

customer_reviews.title: "Really" this is a YETI
customer_reviews.text: Bought this off amazon and I really think it has no insulation in it. Does not keep just ice for a single day! What a rip off. I have a Colman extreme that keeps ice for at least three days in 80+ degree days. DO NOT buy this, its a complete waste of money!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan R.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: It's a YetI. So its tough, keeps everything cold for a long time and it's perfect for our camping & boating, or just having out on the deck or in the back of the truck.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Hardeman

customer_reviews.title: Fits EVERYTHING
customer_reviews.text: I love the tundra 65 so much because it holds literally everything. A great cooler if you want your drinks and food in one cooler. it can get heavy when its completely filled with all your drinks and ice but its easy to carry with the handles on the side, you just need to people to carry it. I bough the navy one because we already have the sea foam green one and they look great next to each other. yeti coolers will always be my go to cooler, there definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: NO WHEELS
customer_reviews.text: I love this product and the gorgeous aqua color but I am SO MAD AT MYSELF for not realizing it didn’t have wheels. Have significant back problem and it’s an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Gillian

customer_reviews.title: well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: the cooler is so well made and really keeps the stuff cold, we use it all the time when going shopping to keep the stuff cold until we get home
customer_reviews.author: Robert Sandberg

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Ice melted on day one. Can’t get a hold of Yeti. Been on hold over two hours.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon B.

customer_reviews.title: High quality, holds ice for days
customer_reviews.text: Got this for Burning Man and it worked as expected. Held ice for 4 days and it was very convenient, high quality. Also love the blue color. It stands out among other coolers.
customer_reviews.author: Cuteitemsfangirl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent !
customer_reviews.text: Great cooler, probably the best I’ve ever had. Keeps everything inside very cold and ice lasts about 2 to 3 days. Built solid, can be used as a bench or seat or you can stand on it.
customer_reviews.author: Hamptonman

customer_reviews.title: Loving it!
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about this! We got the mint and even my man warmed up to the color after calling it girly. Keeps things cold for a long time and easy to use/clean. I can see why you might get the version with wheels though. Only thing we didn’t love was that it got dirty easy (it is a light color) and it wasn’t that easy to wipe down. Since it’s an outdoor product, it would be nice if it were a tiny bit easier to get the dirt off.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and workmanship
customer_reviews.text: Upon receiving the cooler, I immediately could tell the difference in quality compared to my other coolers. I see all these other owners complain about the cooler. You simply have to pre cool it prior to using the cooler.
customer_reviews.author: MauiSupper

customer_reviews.title: It's a Yeti!!! Cant ever go wrong with a Yeti!
customer_reviews.text: Originally we bought a 45 and ended up returning it to get this 65. It is just a better Bang for our buck. You can't go wrong with a yeti ever!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: BEST COOLERS EVER
customer_reviews.text: Great cooler best ever i have 3 of them 65-45-35 all really do the job
customer_reviews.author: gb

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Ice Chest
customer_reviews.text: I already had another Yeti so I knew what I was getting. This didn’t disappoint. I would recommend getting the Yeti ice to assist in cooling the chest contents.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro

customer_reviews.title: HEAVY HEAVY COOLER UNLOADED!!
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is HEAVY before you put anything in it. Area of storage is poor. Ice is about the same as others we have. I have used it twice and looking to sell it.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Held ice like a dream in the Adirondacks over a week long ...
customer_reviews.text: Held ice like a dream in the Adirondacks over a week long hot spell with record high temperatures! With no central air the cabin, it was on average 80-85 degree every day inside and did not cool down much at night. Followed tips provided with Cooler and could not be happier with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my daughter and son-in-law for their anniversary. I wish an ice pack would have come with it. It came on time. It is not made in America and there are some coolers that are the same style, cheaper and made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: We love everything Yeti and everything Aqua!! High quality and that color just makes me smile!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: just what I needed in case of a hurricane
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Yeti cooler in anticipation of Hurricane Florence. Our neighborhood frequently loses power in hurricanes, but as it turned out, this hurricane missed us so no power outage. however, I had the Yeti ready and was thrilled to see that even after a couple of days, drinks stored in it were still cold! I am ready for the next power outage with this!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I heard good things about this and also the rtic. I chose this because I would have been wondering if it were better than the rtic.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooler
customer_reviews.text: I keep this in my pool deck and fill it with ice once a week. Great cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy cooler
customer_reviews.text: Great for keeping anything cold which is no surprise for a cooler. It is MUCH heavier than anticipated but does the job better than any other cooler that I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great if you get it on sale
customer_reviews.text: I mean, it’s a Yeti. Well built and really works but still overpriced. I got mine on Black Friday sale so I save $100. Wait for a sale and it’s well worth it
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M.

customer_reviews.title: TOO MUCH MONEY FOR NOT ENOUGH COOLER
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE THIS COOLER INSIDE THE HOUSE MY HOUSE AT 72o F AND I LOADED THIS COOLER WITH 30 LBS OF ICE AND NO DRINKS, HOW LONG IS THE ICE SUPPOSE TO LAST ? ONLY 24 HRS !!! DO THEY HAVE DIFFERENT MANUFACTURING ? I WOULD LIKE SPEAK TO SOMEONE ABOUT THIS 2 COOLERS THAT COST ME $700 PLUS TAX
customer_reviews.author: PRIMMOZ

customer_reviews.title: Want it cold ?  Get a cooler.  Want it cold a week from now, get a Yeti !
customer_reviews.text: I seriously disagree with their politics, but they do build a quality cooler that will keep ice for more than a week.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sandorf

customer_reviews.title: YES, YES YES
customer_reviews.text: it's a yeti do you need any more information. It is the best cooler i have ever owned. I am already looking for a bigger one :)
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Munoz

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: So heavy that we had to buy a cart to pull it but it def holds ice .
customer_reviews.author: TRACY L. GINGER

customer_reviews.title: Great*****
customer_reviews.text: I use it every weekend for groceries all year long.
customer_reviews.author: DLeal

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I love that it doesn’t leak. But disappointed it doesn’t keep ice like a Yeti cup.
customer_reviews.author: chrissielee

customer_reviews.title: Keeps cool longer
customer_reviews.text: I love the color and capacity of this cooler. This cooler really works well.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Love our YETI
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband for Father's Day and he LOVES it! It literally kept drinks cold for days! I wish we would have purchased this long ago, rather than spending money on other coolers!
customer_reviews.author: Faith Loyd

customer_reviews.title: Holds ice
customer_reviews.text: Held ice 4 days while others camping had to get ice daily
customer_reviews.author: Don Dahlmeier

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Well made but very disappointed. Went on an 8000 mile road trip. Temps up to 80 during the day and down to mid 30's at night. Precooled it and loaded it with 14lbs of ice. Opened it briefly three times a day. Ice lasted 3 days max. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Returns
customer_reviews.text: It's been difficult to return this item back. I've been waiting for someone to it pick up for almost a week now.
customer_reviews.author: Eskimogall

customer_reviews.title: It is heavy even when empty
customer_reviews.text: It works great - we were out for 1 week and nothing spoiled but it is just a heavy piece of equipment. I am a 45 year old single woman and it takes a lot of strength to lift it.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Easton

customer_reviews.title: This cooler is well worth the money spent!!
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the item. Really keep ice from melting quickly. I sell sodas and was having to buy at least 2 bags a day. Since purchasing ice keep for days. Really a money saver. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: minnie swift

customer_reviews.title: Works great whether I am on shore power or not.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for keeping food in my camper. Works whether driving down the road or parked. Don't have to worry about loss of power. Don't even have to think twice if I want to boondock. I call it freedom.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda L Tinney

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Just used for the first time and it worked great
customer_reviews.author: Chris Miley

customer_reviews.title: Keeps ice for 5 days
customer_reviews.text: without pre-chilling the cooler, we had ice in our 70* house for five days after a party. this is great cause we don't have to keep buying ice for road-trips and dumping the water out like previous coolers
customer_reviews.author: Cas Pterodactyl

customer_reviews.title: Sent us the wrong cooler
customer_reviews.text: We ordered a Yeti 65 ($350) and they sent us a Yeti 24 ($200). All Amazon could do was issue a refund and tell us to ship it back. Really inconvenient and disappointing. We'll try to find an alternative to get the cooler we want.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps everything cold for so long!
customer_reviews.text: The Yeti 65 Tundra is awesome! It keeps everything sooo cold! Ice doesn’t melt for days.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Robinson

customer_reviews.title: I love my Yeti
customer_reviews.text: It's a great cooler but very heavy & in this size wheels are a necessity once you load it up!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: This is a great cooler. It is worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cooler. It is worth the price. Sturdy, durable, great for barbeques, camping, etc. Keeps items cold for days.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: This product only stays cold for 24 hours. May not be the best purchase if dry camping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best, hands down.
customer_reviews.text: The light blue color is awesome. It’s sturdy and will keep ice for a while. Make sure that you pre chill it. Also comes with a removable basket tray.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yeti cooler  2  thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing how well it keeps cold under warm conditions
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: First time use for the cooler and the leakproof drain leaked like crazy! Did not check prior to return date, our bad, (missed by one week). Hopefully Yeti customer service will help!
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Pricey for a reason
customer_reviews.text: This cooler literally kept ice for up to a week. Super sturdy and WILL keep your stuff cold.
customer_reviews.author: Seisho L.

customer_reviews.title: Holds ice for days!
customer_reviews.text: My 3rd Yeti. Love them. Use them when I go out in the boat and camping. Only reason you get another one is you want bigger. They last forever. 1st one is 7 years old now and as good as it was day 1.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Heenan

customer_reviews.title: Best Cooler Ever Made
customer_reviews.text: I work as a faller and it hits 105 every day out there. Absolutely the best cooler, keeps drinks ice cold in that heat. It keeps ice longer than any cooler I’ve ever had. Absolutely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Scheinman

customer_reviews.title: Would reccomend purchasing
customer_reviews.text: There's nothing like a Yeti brand anything. This cooler keeps our ice longer and food colder than anything we've ever owned. Worth the extra money you spend for quality!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great but a little heavy for me.
customer_reviews.text: Color was perfect! It was everything it should be. Very sturdy and works great. Just a little heavy to load and unload for me but my son has no problems. It was a wonderful gift!
customer_reviews.author: Reba Webb

customer_reviews.title: Pretty fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I work out of town, so I fill it up every week to go to a hotel. Never had a cooler even close to as good.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Yeti is great
customer_reviews.text: Yeti is a great product I bought this Yeti for our grandson's Senior class to auction off for $$ for their Senior class trip I even got it a day sooner than expected
customer_reviews.author: Kaye B.

customer_reviews.title: Needs better colors
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Keeps ice amazingly! Color choices aren't super great. We went with the darker teal.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Heim

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: GOT THIS FOR MY HUSBAND FOR HIS BIRTHDAY AND HE LOVES IT!
customer_reviews.author: CHRISSY M

customer_reviews.title: Overrated
customer_reviews.text: Cooler fell over and clips broke that hold the lid latch No way it’s worth the $400 payed for supposed to be a life long cooler lifetime my butt!
customer_reviews.author: Chris lane

customer_reviews.title: Use
customer_reviews.text: It's a Yeti, what more do you need to know
customer_reviews.author: Brad Heller

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my son - and he absolutely loves it
customer_reviews.author: Linda Main

product_meta.title: YETI Tundra 65 Cooler
feature_bullets: The YETI Tundra 65 is just as adept at keeping your catches cold in the field as it is storing the drinks and food for your backyard barbecue, this ice chest is plenty roomy, holding a limit of redfish or your prized brisket
Ice stays ice thanks to up to 3 inches of PermaFrost Insulation and an extra thick FatWall design is certified Bear-Resistant

The Rotomolded Construction makes the Tundra armored to the core and virtually indestructible so wherever you decide to take it, this portable cooler’s sturdy construction will stand up to the rigors of the journey
All Tundra coolers feature T-Rex Lid Latches constructed of heavy-duty rubber so you’ll never see another busted latch and has patented keeper technology
The Tundra 65 dimensions are 30 1/2 in long x 17 1/2 in wide x 16 in high with an empty weight of 29 lbs NOTE: All Tundra models come standard with one dry goods basket.
